content: This is the most horrifinly badly written clash I've ever seen in my life. The Goal just simply doesn't make sense at all. All parameters are some god forsaken order. The sequence definition is clearly created by someone who never seen numbers in order. Everything about this clash is just plain bad. What is that nonsense about not whole numbers? Sigh... This will haunt me in my dreams.

absolutely no chance to guess the problem in reverse mode !!!!!
I've removed this mode.
There is already a sequence CoC.

I changed the constraints to reflect what the text said in numerical form as according to the test cases. Feel free to change the upper and lower bound for a1 and a2 as needed, but k should be left as is.

I solve it with Js, and i had no any problems with it. I guess someone already fixed 5th validator.
I want to approve it, but i think that this clash would be hard for reverse mode, because you have to guess that:
1) its a sequence (mb easy)
2) you have to print ERROR on wrong operators (mb easy)
3) you have to print ERROR on negative number
Second thing is that in my JS solution i didn't round my output at all, and i pass all the test, so you have to add test case for it, or remove it from Statement
If you will fix those i can approve it :)

cf: betacorn

I feel that this clash has been changed beyond what it should have been by someone other than the author ...

the solution was really different first time i looked
using eval ... so many puzzle refused because just using eval ...
I cleaned up the statement and added the negative ERROR case. I also came up with a valid Python3 solution.
I'd approve this if the 5th validator would be smaller. As Karamuto points out, this doesn't work in JS.

Sadly this is not solvable in javascript as your validator 5 result is bigger as the MAX_SAFE_INTEGER.

Meaning it results in weird things like:

13126471649072592+21239077280561336=34365548929633930

which is obviously wrong...

like in this example: https://developer.mozilla.org/de/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number/MAX_SAFE_INTEGER
You should clarify the upper bound and the lower bound of Term1 and Term2 in constraints.

I believe this clash is interesting, but the output description is not clear.
1/ You introduce a number r that is not defined. I think you must define it clearly in the input (line 1)
2/ You say that if the number is negative, the output is ERROR. I think it is a mistake.
3/ The number you output is not rounded to the nearest whole number. Your code output the greatest integer less than or equal to Term (n+2)
So it's really SEQUENCES by zest, user_a,user_b,user_x,and user_y
Maybe it could just be made invalid for reverse mode?
I can add one more test case (about "rounded to the nearest whole number") and remove reverse from clash mods, but i dont know if author is OK about it
